abstract: Albany Judge Gary F Stiglmeier dismisses misdemeanor prostitution charges against Green Garden Asian Spa worker Min Liu, filed by county prosecutors in 2012; spa's owner, Bin Cheng, is wife of J Robert Port, investigations editor at Times Union of Albany; Port has insisted his wife's business was targeted out of retaliation for series of Times Union articles criticizing tactics of a drug unit under Albany County sheriff's command.
lead_paragraph: The investigators editor at the Albany Times Union, J. Robert Port, said the 2012 raid at a spa his wife owned was done in retaliation for articles critical of the police.

headline.main: Prostitution Charge Dropped in Case an Albany Journalist Called Retaliation
headline.print_headline: Prostitution Charge Dropped in Arrest That Albany Editor Saw as Retaliation

snippet: The investigators editor at the Albany Times Union, J. Robert Port, said the 2012 raid at a spa his wife owned was done in retaliation for articles critical of the police.
